Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Morale \Mo`rale"\, n. [F. See {Moral}, a.] The moral condition, or the condition in other respects, so far as it is affected by, or dependent upon, moral considerations, such as zeal, spirit, hope, and confidence; mental state, as of a body of men, an army, and the like. [1913 Webster]

morale n 1: a state of individual psychological well-being based upon a sense of confidence and usefulness and purpose 2: the spirit of a group that makes the members want the group to succeed [syn: {esprit de corps}, {team spirit}]
